info.title: ODDSCORP.COM: API for bookmaker sure bets, value bets and information about LIVE and PREMATCH sports events
info.description:
ODDSCORP.COM - API for receiving bookmaker sure bets, value bets and information about LIVE and PREMATCH sports events from various bookmakers and exchanges:
bet365, 1xbet, fonbet, betcity, betfair, bingoboom (betboom), bookmaker, winline, stake, pinnacle, parimatch, olimp, marathon, ligastavok, 188bet and others.

The list of all available bookmakers can be viewed at this link. Upon request we are ready to add other bookmakers.

In our bookmaker API for betting, you will find information on sports events from 65+ bookmakers. You will be able to use the API data to make value bets and arbitrage bets.

Contact support (telegram: @oddscorp, email: support@oddscorp.com) and you will be provided with a trial period to receive bookmaker sure bets, value bets, updating odds in live and prematch via API.

Our telegram channel with useful information

Русская версия документации доступна по этой ссылке.

tags.name: Event
tags.description:
Event at a specific bookmaker
<SchemaDefinition schemaRef="#/components/schemas/Event" />

get.description:
Returns a list of value bets according to specified parameters

__Request example:__ http://api.oddscp.com:8111/valuebets?bk_name=fonbet&alive_sec=2&get_market_data=2&token=gd7a8fdggrtfg34b6c

__For calculations it is necessary to use data only from "valuing_data".__
**Examples and description of score formation (expand):**


**H** - half
**G** - game
**M** - map (esports)
**R** - round
**T** - period
**S** - set
**P** - period
**I** - inning (baseball)
**Q** - quarter

**OT** - overtime
**B** - break
__*__ - whose serve (Badminton, Volleyball)


**Examples:**
**1:0 (6:3)|T2,B**

**B** - means break before 2nd period;

———
**1:0 (6:3 0:0)|S2,B**

**"1:0"** - current score;
**"6:3"** - in the first set;
**"0:0"** - this is the score in the second set;
**S2,B** - now break before the second set;

———
**1:1 (0:1 1:0) 68`**

**"68"** - minutes of play from the start of the match;
**"1:1"** - current score;
**"(0:1 1:0)"** - second half is going on. In the first half the 2nd team scored, and in the second half the 1st team scored;

**Description of meta components (expand):**


Meta can change depending on sport and bookmaker! Be careful!
We usually don't remove old data, only add new. We always try to inform about changes through our official telegram channel.
Something from meta may not be current or if you have any questions, please clarify with tech support.

We can add something new to meta if you need it. There is a 250 character limit in meta, but we will try to fit it.

———
**Pinnacle**
**"key":"s;0;s;0.25** - this is marketKey, specifically this one - handicap in play 0.25
**"dest"** - can be "null" if the outcome doesn't have this field
**"dest\":\"under\"** - new key for TU (TotalUnder)
**"dest\":\"over\"** - new key for TO (TotalOver)
**"points"** - for handicaps and totals with original value from API, i.e. without considering sign and score for handicaps. For other bet types, the 'points' field is not added to meta.

**"homeTeamType"** - Team1 / Team2. Team order, which team is meant as home.
- if homeTeamType=TEAM1, then the team order on pinnacle is the same as we indicate
- if homeTeamType=TEAM2, then the team order on pinnacle is reversed, and the second team should be indicated first

**"team"** - TEAM1 / TEAM2. In our sure bet/value data you need to follow this parameter.
- if team=TEAM1 and we see P2, then the bet needs to be changed (P2 to P1)
- if team=TEAM2 and we see P1, then also need to change (P1 to P2)
- if team is empty (this can be for some sports), then do nothing

**homeTeamType and team are important parameters**, because some events on pinnacle have reversed team order. More details with examples can be found at this link.

———
**Parimatch(parimatch_com)**
Abbreviated parameter names in meta:
"resultKind\":\"rK\"
"outcomeType\":\"oT\"
"period\":\"p\"
"subPeriod\":\"sP\"
"marketType\":\"mT\"
"marketParameters\":\"mP\"
"outcomeParameters\":\"oP\"
"market_name\":\"mN\"
"outcome_name\":\"oN\"
"lineItemId\":\"lIId\"

———
**Fonbet:**
**live_delay** - variable directly from fonbet "internals". You can ignore it.
The higher the live_delay, the longer the bet will be accepted. There are bets that are accepted instantly - they have live_delay=0 or 1.
Standard is 3-4, but there are matches where it's 5-6.

———
**Unibet**
**boId** - this is bet group id
**id** - this is directly bet id
**event_id** - eId

———
**Efbet**
**pu** - currentpriceup
**pd** - currentpricedown
**shc** - selectionhashcode
**m**n - marketname
**im** - idfomarket
**et** - eachwayterms
**prt** - pricetypes (everywhere)
**hv** - hadvalue (not set everywhere, so to not lose it we made it null if missing). HV - not always, actually it's Home/Away/Draw value, exists in some bets but not all. Mostly where it's critical for their internal bet identification.

At event level, a key is added to meta orig_name - event name as it is on efbet API.

———
**1xbet family (melbet/1xstavka)**
**NB** - nameBet/name_bet
**NG** - nameGroup/name_group
**C** - Price
**G** - Bet group id
**P** - bet identifier, used in handicaps/totals
**T** - bet identifier
**SSI** - SubsportID
**GN** - gameNum
**ei** - event_id
**gi** - game_id

———
**888**
**s_name** - sport name on site

———
**bet365**
**visible_ru** - false/true, "visibility" flag. Information about match "visibility" from RF version of site. This is determined by several criteria, they are not on the surface.
**true** - match is visible
**false** - match is unavailable for RF version.
Information is available in meta-data for the event itself

———
**eurobet**
**betGroup** - top group
**oggGroup** - what's inside the block
**odd** - third level text
**resultCode** - button id, they go in order there, there's no such thing in html, but with this meta you can generally find the bet without much problem

parameters.name: live
parameters.description: Getting **PREMATCH value bets**. Specify "**&live=0**" to get prematch value bets. By default LIVE value bets are requested, i.e. for LIVE value bets this parameter doesn't need to be specified.

parameters.name: bet_types
parameters.description:
Bet type in value bet
Current list of bet types with detailed description is at this link - http://api.oddscp.com:8111/static/possible_bets_list.txt

parameters.name: sport
parameters.description: Sport

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Getting value bets only for specified event id

parameters.name: bk_name
parameters.description: List of bookmakers on which we search for value bets

parameters.name: min_cf
parameters.description: Minimum odds

parameters.name: max_cf
parameters.description: Maximum odds

parameters.name: min_fi
parameters.description: Minimum value bet %

parameters.name: max_fi
parameters.description: Maximum value bet %

parameters.name: alive_sec
parameters.description: Minimum time of value bet existence for specified percentage (-1%)

parameters.name: alive_prc
parameters.description: Value bet percentage relative to which alive_sec is calculated

parameters.name: get_market_data
parameters.description:
Enable display of value calculations. valuing_data will appear including, with __"1"__ - odds at other bookmakers, value calculations. __"2"__ - odds at other bookmakers, value calculations, score at other bookmakers and last odds change time.
For sports soccer, table-tennis, tennis, volleyball - mandatory score check is enabled. Calculations only include bookmakers whose score matches the main bookmaker. For other sports there is no mandatory score check.
Description of valuing_data values: (expand)


need_cfs - array of odds participating in calculations below

cf_orig - this is the original odds (for the same bet we set in url)
cf_mdn - median odds across all bookmakers including requested
cf_avg - average odds (arithmetic mean)
cf_avg2 and cf_mdn2 - this is test data, you can skip it
diff_avg - this is difference cf_avg - cf_orig (in % of course)
diff_mdn - difference cf_mdn - cf_orig
min_max_dst - this is difference in % between min and max odds across all bookmakers
total_cnt - number of odds
total_pos - this is position of requested odds on line of sorted odds (if our odds is best, then value will be 1.0, and if worst, then 0.0)
better_cnt - number of odds that are >= current
aw_avg - conversion with margin (aw = - ). Arithmetic mean.
aw_mdn - conversion with margin (aw = - ). Median.
ow_avg - expected ROI (ow = \*2 - ) Arithmetic mean.
ow_mdn - expected ROI (ow = \*2 - ). Median.
min_aw - conversion with margin (aw = - ). Minimum.
min_ow - expected ROI (ow = \*2 - ). Minimum.
min_diff - this is difference cf_(minimum) - cf_orig
ow2_avg - calculation is based on conversion of winning sizes - by formula (CF2 - CF1)/CF1. Arithmetic mean.
ow2_mdn - calculation is based on conversion of winning sizes - by formula (CF2 - CF1)/CF1. Median.

Probability conversion - calculated by formula (1/CF1 - 1/CF2)

Inside valuing_data.cfs array the following data for each bookmaker:
- Current odds
- How many seconds ago odds changed
- Current score in match
- Margin. Here's simple margin calculation formula: http://prnt.sc/id-rNccQSMxl

get.description:
Request to get detailed information about individual value bet (by event ID at bookmaker and bet). You will see - odds at other bookmakers, value calculations, score at other bookmakers and last odds change time.

**This type of clarifying request is only available for additional fee!!! Please clarify details with support.**

**Example clarifying request for live value bet:** http://api.oddscp.com:8111/values/get_market_data/BT3SCDD314B746FF/WIN__P1?&token=afdjd8fd8rjkfu7fa7f3

**Example clarifying request for prematch value bet:** http://api.oddscp.com:8111/values/get_market_data/BT3SCDD314B746FF/WIN__P1?&token=afdjd8fd8rjkfu7fa7f3&live=0 (note parameter **live=0**)

**▶ List of all bookmakers and their abbreviations in "CFS" parameter (open)**
Description of values in value calculations (expand):


need_cfs - array of odds participating in calculations below

cf_orig - this is desired odds (for same bet we passed in url)
cf_mdn - median odds across all bookmakers including requested
cf_avg - average odds (arithmetic mean)
cf_avg2 and cf_mdn2 - this is test data, you can skip
diff_avg - this is difference cf_avg - cf_orig (in % of course)
diff_mdn - difference cf_mdn - cf_orig
min_max_dst - this is difference in % between min and max odds across all bookmakers
total_cnt - number of odds
total_pos - this is position of requested odds on line of sorted odds (if our odds is best, then value will be 1.0, and if worst, then 0.0)
better_cnt - number of odds that are >= current
aw_avg - conversion with margin (aw = - ). Arithmetic mean.
aw_mdn - conversion with margin (aw = - ). Median.
ow_avg - expected ROI (ow = \*2 - ) Arithmetic mean.
ow_mdn - expected ROI (ow = \*2 - ). Median.
min_aw - conversion with margin (aw = - ). Minimum.
min_ow - expected ROI (ow = \*2 - ). Minimum.
min_diff - this is difference cf_(minimum) - cf_orig
ow2_avg - calculation based on conversion of winning sizes - by formula (CF2 - CF1)/CF1. Arithmetic mean.
ow2_mdn - calculation based on conversion of winning sizes - by formula (CF2 - CF1)/CF1. Median.

Probability conversion - calculated by formula (1/CF1 - 1/CF2)

Inside valuing_data.cfs array following data for each bookmaker:
- Current odds
- How many seconds ago odds changed
- Current score in match
- Margin. Here's simple margin calculation formula: http://prntscr.com/vmgtfj (source)

**Examples and description of score formation (expand):**


**H** - half
**G** - game
**M** - map (esports)
**R** - round
**T** - period
**S** - set
**P** - period
**I** - inning (baseball)
**Q** - quarter

**OT** - overtime
**B** - break
__*__ - whose serve (Badminton, Volleyball)


**Examples:**
**1:0 (6:3)|T2,B**

**B** - means break before 2nd period;

———
**1:0 (6:3 0:0)|S2,B**

**"1:0"** - current score;
**"6:3"** - in first set;
**"0:0"** - this is score in second set;
**S2,B** - now break before second set;

———
**1:1 (0:1 1:0) 68`**

**"68"** - minutes of play from start of match;
**"1:1"** - current score;
**"(0:1 1:0)"** - second half going on. In first half 2nd team scored, and in second half 1st team scored;

parameters.name: BK1_event_id
parameters.description: Event identifier at bookmaker

parameters.name: BK1_bet
parameters.description: Bet at bookmaker

parameters.name: sf
parameters.description: Enable score check between bookmakers, i.e. exclusion from value calculations of bookmakers that haven't updated score yet. By default for value bets score check is enabled to avoid erroneous value bets due to data update delay at bookmakers. Specify "**&sf=1**" to use in calculations only bookmakers with correct score.

get.description: Returns list of available sports with description

Returns list of available bookmakers with description. The list will include
only those bookmakers that were requested/paid for in your tariff.

Returns list of PREMATCH / LIVE sure bets according to specified parameters

__Request example:__ http://api.oddscp.com:8111/forks?bk2_name=pinnacle,bet365,fonbet&min_fi=1&token=afdjd8fd8rjkfu7fa7f3

get.summary: Get list of PREMATCH / LIVE sure bets

parameters.name: live
parameters.description: Getting **PREMATCH sure bets**. Specify "**&live=0**" to get prematch sure bets. By default LIVE sure bets are requested, i.e. for LIVE sure bets this parameter doesn't need to be specified.

parameters.name: bet_types
parameters.description:
Bet type in sure bet.
Current list of bet types with detailed description is at this link - http://api.oddscp.com:8111/static/possible_bets_list.txt

parameters.name: sport
parameters.description: Sport

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Getting sure bets only for specified event id

parameters.name: bk2_name
parameters.description: List of bookmakers participating in sure bet

parameters.name: bk_name
parameters.description: Bookmaker that must participate in sure bet

parameters.name: min_cf
parameters.description: Minimum odds

parameters.name: max_cf
parameters.description: Maximum odds

parameters.name: min_fi
parameters.description: Minimum sure bet %

parameters.name: max_fi
parameters.description: Maximum sure bet %

parameters.name: is_middles
parameters.description:
Middles in output. -1 - without middles. 0 - sure bets and middles.
1 - only middles

parameters.name: alive_sec
parameters.description: Minimum time of sure bet existence for specified percentage (-1%)

parameters.name: alive_prc
parameters.description: sure bet percentage relative to which alive_sec is calculated

parameters.name: get_cfs
parameters.description:
(Parameter available only for additional fee, clarify price with tech support). Outputs list of odds for current market on all bookmakers at given moment and outputs current score on sure bet match. In response will appear 3 keys - cfs1, cfs2, all_scores.
**Usage methods (expand):**

First of all, should be used to determine "sure bet initiator". In this case you should go through the entire list of bookmakers and calculate sure bets by standard formula (we will help with this if you don't have it) from the percentage you need.

Also, you should definitely consider "mirrors" - optimal option is to take the highest odds from all mirror offices. The list of mirrors itself can be obtained using data from /bookmakers method.

Besides determining the "initiator", this data can be used for deeper customization of your strategies, or simply put - filter the general flow of sure bets. How exactly? Here everything remains at the discretion of your own imagination and your experience.

Having the current score on the sure bet match for all bookmakers will allow you to analyze the current situation in more detail and be more confident in the bets you make.

parameters.name: score_filter
parameters.description: Disable score check between bookmakers. By default for sure bets on soccer and hockey score check is enabled to avoid erroneous sure bets due to data update delay at bookmakers. For other sports this parameter doesn't work. Specify "**&score_filter=0**" to disable score check.

parameters.name: show_swap
parameters.description: Show whether team order was reversed for each bookmaker in sure bet. In response will appear 2 keys - BK1_event_swapped and BK2_event_swapped. Specify "**&show_swap=1**" to enable display.

get.description:
Request to get detailed information about individual sure bet (by its key)

**Example request for prematch sure bet:** http://api.oddscp.com:8111/forks/13596cec090d11ac3b?live=0&token=afdjd8fd8rjkfu7fa7f3 (note parameter **live=0**)

**Example request for live sure bet:** http://api.oddscp.com:8111/forks/13596cec090d11ac3b?&token=afdjd8fd8rjkfu7fa7f3

**oggGroup** - what's inside the block
**odd** - third level text
**resultCode** - button id, they go in order there, there's no such thing in html, but with this meta you can generally find the bet without much problem

parameters.name: fork_id
parameters.description: sure bet identifier

get.description:
Request to get all events
**Examples and description of score formation (expand):**


**H** - half
**G** - game
**M** - map (esports)
**R** - round
**T** - period
**S** - set
**P** - period
**I** - inning (baseball)
**Q** - quarter

**OT** - overtime
**B** - break
__*__ - whose serve (Badminton, Volleyball)


**Examples:**
**1:0 (6:3)|T2,B**

**B** - means break before 2nd period;

———
**1:0 (6:3 0:0)|S2,B**

**"1:0"** - current score;
**"6:3"** - in first set;
**"0:0"** - this is score in second set;
**S2,B** - now break before second set;

———
**1:1 (0:1 1:0) 68`**

**"68"** - minutes of play from start of match;
**"1:1"** - current score;
**"(0:1 1:0)"** - second half going on. In first half 2nd team scored, and in second half 1st team scored;

**Description of meta components (expand):**


Meta can change depending on sport and bookmaker! Be careful!
We usually don't remove old data, only add new. We always try to inform about changes through our official telegram channel.
Something from meta may not be current or if you have any questions, please clarify with tech support.

We can add something new to meta if you need it. There is a 250 character limit in meta, but we will try to fit it.

———
**Pinnacle**
**"homeTeamType"** - Team1 / Team2. Team order, which team is meant as home.
- if homeTeamType=TEAM1, then the team order on pinnacle is the same as we indicate
- if homeTeamType=TEAM2, then the team order on pinnacle is reversed, and the second team should be indicated first

**"team"** - TEAM1 / TEAM2. In our sure bet/value data you need to follow this parameter.
- if team=TEAM1 and we see P2, then the bet needs to be changed (P2 to P1)
- if team=TEAM2 and we see P1, then also need to change (P1 to P2)
- if team is empty (this can be for some sports), then do nothing

**homeTeamType and team are important parameters**, because some events on pinnacle have reversed team order. More details with examples can be found at this link.


**Pinnacle:prematch**
**"maybe_freezed"** - 0/1. Sometimes the event start time has already come, but pinnacle continues to give data about the event via API as if it's still available in prematch, although including on the pinnacle site itself it's no longer there. For such events "maybe_freezed":1 will be assigned
You can no longer bet on such odds, you can deal with these events at your discretion.

———

parameters.name: sport
parameters.description: Sport

parameters.name: bk_name
parameters.description: Bookmaker identifier

parameters.name: live
parameters.description: Getting **PREMATCH events**. Specify "**&live=0**" to get prematch events. By default LIVE events are requested, i.e. for LIVE events this parameter doesn't need to be specified.

get.summary: Search for event at specific bookmaker
get.description:
Request to search for specific event by id or name
**Examples and description of score formation (expand):**


**H** - half
**G** - game
**M** - map (esports)
**R** - round
**T** - period
**S** - set
**P** - period
**I** - inning (baseball)
**Q** - quarter

**OT** - overtime
**B** - break
__*__ - whose serve (Badminton, Volleyball)


**Examples:**
**1:0 (6:3)|T2,B**

**B** - means break before 2nd period;

———
**1:0 (6:3 0:0)|S2,B**

**"1:0"** - current score;
**"6:3"** - in first set;
**"0:0"** - this is score in second set;
**S2,B** - now break before second set;

———
**1:1 (0:1 1:0) 68`**

**"68"** - minutes of play from start of match;
**"1:1"** - current score;
**"(0:1 1:0)"** - second half going on. In first half 2nd team scored, and in second half 1st team scored;

parameters.name: bk_event_id
parameters.description: event id

get.description:
Request to get all events from different bookmakers that are grouped together

__Request example:__ http://api.oddscp.com:8111/groups/23313791?show_names=1&token=afdjd8fd8rjkfu7fa7f3

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: group id

parameters.name: show_names
parameters.description: Specify "**?show_names=1**" to display names of grouped events.

event_names.CBGSC38C2AA10324: Abingdon United W. vs Maidenhead United W.
event_names.BT3SC88126EEE8F0: Abingdon United Women vs Maidenhead Utd Women

get.description:
Request to search for markets by specified parameters.
One of the parameters is mandatory in request - __bk_event_ids__ and/or __bk_name__
**Description of meta components (expand):**


Meta can change depending on sport and bookmaker! Be careful!
We usually don't remove old data, only add new. We always try to inform about changes through our official telegram channel.
Something from meta may not be current or if you have any questions, please clarify with tech support.

We can add something new to meta if you need it. There is a 250 character limit in meta, but we will try to fit it.

———
**Pinnacle**
**"key":"s;0;s;0.25** - this is marketKey, specifically this one - handicap in play 0.25
**"dest"** - can be "null" if the outcome doesn't have this field
**"dest\":\"under\"** - new key for TU (TotalUnder)
**"dest\":\"over\"** - new key for TO (TotalOver)
**"points"** - for handicaps and totals with original value from API, i.e. without considering sign and score for handicaps. For other bet types, the 'points' field is not added to meta.

**"homeTeamType"** - Team1 / Team2. Team order, which team is meant as home.
- if homeTeamType=TEAM1, then the team order on pinnacle is the same as we indicate
- if homeTeamType=TEAM2, then the team order on pinnacle is reversed, and the second team should be indicated first

**"team"** - TEAM1 / TEAM2. In our sure bet/value data you need to follow this parameter.
- if team=TEAM1 and we see P2, then the bet needs to be changed (P2 to P1)
- if team=TEAM2 and we see P1, then also need to change (P1 to P2)
- if team is empty (this can be for some sports), then do nothing

**homeTeamType and team are important parameters**, because some events on pinnacle have reversed team order. More details with examples can be found at this link.

———
**Parimatch(parimatch_com)**
Abbreviated parameter names in meta:
"resultKind\":\"rK\"
"outcomeType\":\"oT\"
"period\":\"p\"
"subPeriod\":\"sP\"
"marketType\":\"mT\"
"marketParameters\":\"mP\"
"outcomeParameters\":\"oP\"
"market_name\":\"mN\"
"outcome_name\":\"oN\"
"lineItemId\":\"lIId\"

———
**Fonbet:**
**live_delay** - variable directly from fonbet "internals". You can ignore it.
The higher the live_delay, the longer the bet will be accepted. There are bets that are accepted instantly - they have live_delay=0 or 1.
Standard is 3-4, but there are matches where it's 5-6.

———
**Unibet**
**boId** - this is bet group id
**id** - this is directly bet id
**event_id** - eId

———
**Efbet**
**pu** - currentpriceup
**pd** - currentpricedown
**shc** - selectionhashcode
**m**n - marketname
**im** - idfomarket
**et** - eachwayterms
**prt** - pricetypes (everywhere)
**hv** - hadvalue (not set everywhere, so to not lose it we made it null if missing). HV - not always, actually it's Home/Away/Draw value, exists in some bets but not all. Mostly where it's critical for their internal bet identification.

At event level, a key is added to meta orig_name - event name as it is on efbet API.

———
**1xbet family (melbet/1xstavka)**
**NB** - nameBet/name_bet
**NG** - nameGroup/name_group
**C** - Price
**G** - Bet group id
**P** - bet identifier, used in handicaps/totals
**T** - bet identifier
**SSI** - SubsportID
**GN** - gameNum
**ei** - event_id
**gi** - game_id

———
**888**
**s_name** - sport name on site

———
**bet365**
**visible_ru** - false/true, "visibility" flag. Information about match "visibility" from RF version of site. This is determined by several criteria, they are not on the surface.
**true** - match is visible
**false** - match is unavailable for RF version.
Information is available in meta-data for the event itself

———
**eurobet**
**betGroup** - top group
**oggGroup** - what's inside the block
**odd** - third level text
**resultCode** - button id, they go in order there, there's no such thing in html, but with this meta you can generally find the bet without much problem

parameters.name: bk_event_ids
parameters.description: list of event ids

parameters.name: sport
parameters.description: List of sports types

parameters.name: bk_name
parameters.description: Bookmaker identifier

get.summary: Getting all markets for specific event

———

**NB** - nameBet/name_bet
**NG** - nameGroup/name_group
**C** - Price
**G** - Bet group id
**P** - bet identifier, used in handicaps/totals
**T** - bet identifier
**SSI** - SubsportID
**GN** - gameNum
**ei** - event_id
**gi** - game_id

———
**888**
**s_name** - sport name on site

———
**bet365**
**visible_ru** - false/true, "visibility" flag. Information about match "visibility" from RF version of site. This is determined by several criteria, they are not on the surface.
**true** - match is visible
**false** - match is unavailable for RF version.
Information is available in meta-data for the event itself

———
**eurobet**
**betGroup** - top group
**oggGroup** - what's inside the block
**odd** - third level text
**resultCode** - button id, they go in order there, there's no such thing in html, but with this meta you can generally find the bet without much problem

parameters.name: bk_event_id
parameters.description: event id

BK1_name.description: Bookmaker identifier where value bet is (BK-1)

bet_type.description:
General bet type in sure bet. If bk1_bet_type = bk2_bet_type,
then bet_type = bk1_bet_type, otherwise MIX

BK1_event_native_id.description: Event identifier (native, as at bookmaker itself) at BK-1

BK2_event_native_id.description: Event identifier (native, as at bookmaker itself) at BK-2

BK1_event_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for event at BK-1

BK2_event_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for event at BK-2

BK1_market_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for finding needed bet at BK-1

BK2_market_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for finding needed bet at BK-2

alive_sec.description: How many seconds sure bet has percentage above specified in alive_prc (-1%)

valuing_data.description: Format - JSON. Odds at other bookmakers, value calculations, score at other bookmakers and last odds change time.

cfs.description: Odds at other bookmakers (Current odds, How many seconds ago odds changed, Current score in match, Margin.)

is_middles.description: false - regular sure bet, true - middle

is_cyber.description: false - not esports, true - is esports

bet_type.description:
General bet type in sure bet. If bk1_bet_type = bk2_bet_type,
then bet_type = bk1_bet_type, otherwise MIX

BK1_event_native_id.description: Event identifier (native, as at bookmaker itself) at BK-1

BK2_event_native_id.description: Event identifier (native, as at bookmaker itself) at BK-2

BK1_event_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for event at BK-1

BK2_event_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for event at BK-2

BK1_market_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for finding needed bet at BK-1

BK2_market_meta.description: Format: JSON. Meta-data for finding needed bet at BK-2

alive_sec.description: How many seconds sure bet has percentage above specified in alive_prc (-1%)

all_scores.description: Current score on sure bet match across all bookmakers.

BK1_event_swapped.description: Was team order reversed at BK1.

BK2_event_swapped.description: Was team order reversed at BK2.

blocked.description: Bet blocking indicator (bet unavailable at bookmaker itself)

meta.description: JSON format. Meta-data for finding needed bet at bookmaker.

updated_at_ms.description: Timestamp of last bet update in milliseconds

URITokenAuth.description:
User key is passed with all other parameters in
Query String. It can be found in Personal Account, after payment/connection
of tariff.
URITokenAuth.name: token

UnauthorizedError.description: Token is missing, expired or insufficient permissions
